entries.title: Russian hackers are trying to get the worst out of ChatGPT
entries.description: Crooks are discussing bypassing protections and abusing the AI-powered chatbot.

entries.title: CircleCI confirms customer data was stolen in malware-powered hack
entries.description: CircleCI employee with high privileges had their laptop compromised with token-stealing malware.

entries.title: Thousands of WordPress sites could be at risk, so patch now
entries.description: Top ecommerce plugins made thousands of WordPress installations vulnerable to SQL injection attacks.

entries.title: Asus’ 540Hz HD gaming monitor is just silly
entries.description: Asus' ROG Swift Pro PG248QP gaming monitor may be acapable of 540HZ, but who can realistically put it to good use?

entries.title: Spyware found stealing Iranian user data via infected VPN installer
entries.description: Antivirus provider Bitdefender finds traces of spyware's scripts in Iran VPN 20Speed, with users at risk.

entries.title: Google's DeepMind says it'll launch a more grown-up ChatGPT rival soon
entries.description: Google's DeepMind says it could launch a beta of its Sparrow chatbot in 2023 – and it sounds like ChatGPT's more sensible brother.

entries.title: Brave browser wants to help users access Tor easier
entries.description: Following Brave browser's latest update, anyone can now do their part in the fight against online censorship. Here's how.

entries.title: How DirectStorage 1.1 could make Windows 11 an essential upgrade for PC gamers
entries.description: This could be a transformative innovation for PC gaming, but there’s just one problem: where are the DS 1.1 games?

entries.title: Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 could feature huge camera upgrade over the Z Fold 4
entries.description: A new report suggests that the Galaxy Z Fold 5 could feature a 108MP rear sensor and 64MP telephoto lens.

entries.title: Google Stadia launches one last game before it dies
entries.description: With just days to go until Google Stadia's shutdown, a new title has been added to the cloud gaming service.

entries.title: Thousands of Norton LifeLock customer accounts hacked
entries.description: Credential stuffing attack blamed for resulting in over 6,000 breached accounts.

entries.title: The Elder Scrolls Oblivion fan remake release window revealed by shirtless demon
entries.description: A release date for the immense Skyrim overhaul mod Skyblivion has been revealed.

entries.title: I'm not ready for the furry flesh spider in this Chinese Elden Ring-like RPG
entries.description: A release window for action RPG Black Myth: Wukong has been announced.

entries.title: Intel and Microsoft are operating in Russia once again
entries.description: Reports claim tech giants are now allowing some downloads following initial Russian retreat.

entries.title: Exclusive: Blu-ray successor will cost $1 per 1TB disc... but you'll need a $3,000 drive as well
entries.description: Obscure startup aiming to replace tape and hard drives with 1TB DVD successor.

entries.title: The best thing to come out of Google Stadia will live on after the service dies
entries.description: The Google Stadia controller will live on after the cloud gaming service is shut down, thanks to a self-serve tool.

entries.title: TikTok faces massive fine for insufficient cookie opt-out information
entries.description: TikTok browser version has landed the company in hot water over privacy concerns.

entries.title: Apple's MacBook Air turns 15 - my highs and lows of owning one for 7 years
entries.description: In January 2008, Steve Jobs heralded the 'thin' era of Apple, and one of its best Mac laptops to ever debut.

entries.title: Xiaomi’s Samsung Galaxy S23 Ultra rival might still be months away
entries.description: The Xiaomi 13 Ultra might not land until early April, according to the latest leak.

entries.title: ODIN Intelligence website breached and defaced
entries.description: Incident appears to be linked with reports of SweepWizard leaking sensitive data.

entries.title: Google’s next 4K Chromecast remote will wave goodbye to batteries
entries.description: TW Electronic's new battery-free Google TV remote should make using the next Chromecast much easier.

entries.title: Google Chrome is finally making this important privacy tweak
entries.description: Upcoming Google Chrome update will let users block extensions on a per site basis.

entries.title: Twitter’s broken third-party apps will be the final straw for many users
entries.description: Reports suggest that Twitter has intentionally banned many third-party apps – and that could the final insult for many fans.

entries.title: 2022 saw a huge rise in cyberattacks
entries.description: Education and healthcare were among the worst hit sectors, with many businesses ill-prepared for the pandemic.

entries.title: AMD has revealed a whole host of CPU security flaws
entries.description: Almost three dozen flaws have been addressed across a range of consumer and business devices.

entries.title: The Samsung Galaxy S22 FE might still launch – but it probably shouldn’t
entries.description: The Samsung Galaxy S22 FE is reportedly still planned, but it might not land for a while.

entries.title: Laptops with Nvidia RTX 4090 through to 4050 GPUs are about to go on sale
entries.description: Get ready for a ton of new laptops with Nvidia RTX 4000 graphics cards in February.

entries.title: Netflix really doesn't want you to sign up to its ads-free basic tier
entries.description: Netflix says it won't push customers to sign up to specific subscriptions – but the evidence proves otherwise.

entries.title: Microsoft Defender goes haywire, deletes Start menu icon, Taskbar and more
entries.description: Some sort of a fix has been issued, but many users are still having problems with lost and invisible icons.

entries.title: The best things about Windows 11 are these hidden Easter Eggs and features
entries.description: The best Windows 11 Easter Eggs and secret features I’ve found.
